duties_responsibilities.duty: Design, build, test, and maintain reusable Lightning Components on Salesforce.com.
Build integrations between Salesforce and external applications using REST, SOAP APIs, Auth, and Single Sign-On.
Work with customers to elicit and analyze their requirements, develop designs, and implement solutions.
Present prototypes/demos to business users as required.
Effectively debug and resolve technical issues and/or defects.
Configure out-of-the-box lightning functionalities on Sales Cloud and Community Cloud.
Support the Salesforce platform operations (SSO, Email Relay, Mobile, etc.) by working with various teams.
Hands-on development experience in programming languages such as SOQL, JavaScript, HTML, Apex, CSS, and Java.
Utilize methodologies such as SOAP, REST, Webservices, XML, JMS, and SOA/Integration technologies.
Demonstrate strong attention to detail, organization skills, and excellent problem-solving skills.
Handle multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.
Negotiate skillfully in tough situations with internal and external groups; can be both direct and diplomatic.
Encourage cross-functional collaboration and work in an Agile/Scrum environment.

education_certification.credential: BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent experience.
Certified Salesforce Platform Developer or equivalent experience.
Experience in configuring out-of-the-box lightning functionalities on Sales Cloud and Community Cloud.
Sales and Community Cloud implementation experience using Live Agent, Omni Channel, CTI Adapters, and API Integrations.
Development experience using Visualforce, APEX, triggers, Classes, Lightning API, Workflows, Object Mapping, and SOQL.
Experience with software deployment, GitHub, Continuous Integration (CI), and Continuous Delivery (CD) concepts, applications, and tools highly preferred.
Experience working in an Agile/Scrum environment.
